context: The slides were relabeled to ensure a blind assessment. The relative organs' mass was calculated as the percentage of the organ mass in relation to the final body mass minus that organ mass. 2.3.2 Detoxification efforts measured through biotransformation enzymes 2.3.2.1 EROD activity in hepatic tissue Hepatic EROD (or biotransformation) activity was assessed following published protocols (Hersikorn and Smits 2011; Kennedy and Jones 1994) with the following modifications. The homogenate was centrifuged in 5ml ultracentrifuge tubes at 10, 000 g, 2°C, for 10min (Beckmann and Colter Inc., Chino, CA, USA), transferred into a clean tube and centrifuged at 100,000 g, 2°C for 60min. For enzyme activity (CYP 4501A) in the microsomes, 30μl of the substrate 7-ethoxyresorufin (4.7μM), 20μl phosphate buffer (0.05M, pH 8.0), and 60μl samples (~0.5mg/ml microsomal proteins) were incubated in black, 96 well microtiter plates at room temperature for 10min. The reaction was started by adding 30μl β-nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide (NADPH, 2.4mM) and was run for 15min at 39°C, and stopped with 60μl of a fluorescamine in acetonitrile (0.6mg/ml).
